success.name: Dennis Ritchie
success.details: Ritchie was the head of Lucent Technologies System Software Research Department when he retired in 2007.

success.name: Bjarne Stroustrup
success.details: He is a Distinguished Research Professor and holds the College of Engineering Chair in Computer Science at Texas A&M University, a visiting professor at Columbia University, and works at Morgan Stanley.

success.name: James Gosling
success.achievement: Father of the Java programming language
success.details: James has made major contributions to several other software systems, such as NeWS and Gosling Emacs. Due to his extra-ordinary achievements Gosling was elected to Foreign Associate member of the United States National Academy of Engineering.

success.name: Linus Torvalds
success.achievement: Chief architect of the Linux kernel
success.details: He created the revision control system Git as well as the diving log software Subsurface. He was honored, along with Shinya Yamanaka, with the 2012 Millennium Technology Prize by the Technology Academy Finland in recognition of his creation of a new open source operating system for computers leading to the widely used Linux kernel.

success.name: Anders Hejlsberg
success.details: He was the original author of Turbo Pascal and the chief architect of Delphi. He currently works for Microsoft as the lead architect of C# and core developer on TypeScript.
